comment: Far too long. You can be effectively eliminated early and then you have to sit around for hours.
I'd rather undergo Chinese water torture.
Replaced by Twilight Imperium Fourth Edition.

Some people love it. I hate it. Feels like Solitaire in terms on that sometimes luck is against you from set up. Make a mistake 1st turn and you will lose. Then you end up sitting there for hours losing. I understand what they were going for, well made and written but terrible actual play.
Hardcord empire building, diplomacy and backstabbing, set in space. Not my cup of tea...
Русское издание 2 редакции. Игра не пошла никак. Было сыграно наверное 3, может 4 партии. Игра медленно растаскивается на фигурки для п'н'п.
時空爭霸是經典的科幻策略遊戲，玩家會在宇宙中建立自己的帝國並控制資源，需要用策略和謀略來擊敗其他帝國，以贏得最多的勝利點數。
Not my cup of tea; I don't generally like games that combine heavy fighting with heavy negotiation and I tend to turtle. I do like this game more than most of its ilk though.

A good game of space-Axis&Allies, though some game imbalances exists I like this better than the static and often repetitative game of A&A

A better version has been made since
Too long and many chits for my friends to like. We tried to play it once and never played it again. Wish I had the newer edition to try out.
Not a bad game, but it takes way too long to play for what it is.
A 4X game that is clunky, too long, and fraught with balance issues.
A good conept with some nice elements. Pieces were a bit underwhelming. Overall, this was a good game!
Punched and clipped. Includes Borderlands and Distant Suns expansions

2nd Edition. Fun space opera game. Politics, battles, conquest, technology, etc. Caveat: very long playtime, plays best with 6, lots o' bookkeeping (I recommend a windows TI manager). Superseded by several new editions. Update 11/13/17: given to Mike D.
It started it all!
Impulse Buy
So this is the first version which created many memorable moments among my friend and I. Go check the latest version and you won't regret it.

A marvelous experience, though less baroque than its successors. A much more pure experience, it nonetheless still has many roads to victory. I find the political phase in this one more bland, but I far prefer the turn structure. All-in-all probably the best of the TIs, but they all have something to offer.
In this classic, you get a real sense of Christian Petersen photocopying things by hand in the early days of Fantasy Flight.

This was my grail game for a long time. I finally found a copy and then it took almost 3 years to finally table the thing. I think it was worth the wait, as I absolutely loved it. It did take 10 hrs to play, and that was only with 4 players, but we were learning. My plan was to play this once and then move onto the 2nd edition, but I def want to give it another play now, as I feel it is worth more than just a one-off (even if it's just a prototype for what the series would become).

Just a great game. It has luck, but I feel it is less complex than the 3rd Edition which is a good thing. Still plays way to long. Roughly 7 hours in 3 player games. Obviously that time can come down and come down fast, but with that length we can't play it enough to bring length significantly down.

Played 4 player recently and this might be my favorite space epic now...just need to get the time down...and more players...is that to much to ask.
Hey you, get off my planet!! I'm a sucker for player abilities. And the council is a fun idea.

1st edition - 2 sets. Nice blend of mechanics from Settlers, Axis & Allies, Risk & Cosmic Encounter. Ive made a few special scenery hexes for this game myself. Raised this to a 9 as it has consistantly been a game where I walk away from a game of 4+ hours feeling like I want more.
